issue.title: com.spotify.music
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9.23

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.spotify.music

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Legitimate URL Shortener, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List, Fanboy's Anti-thirdparty Fonts

issue.title: chatgpt.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. Observe that the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. > > #### Expected Behavior > The Sora and Project folders should remain visible and accessible even when **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled. > > #### Actual Behavior > As soon as **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled, the folders disappear. > > #### Additional Information > - **OS Version**: Win 11 pro Build 26100.3476 > - **AdGuard Version**: 7.20.2 (4988) > > #### Workaround > Disabling **"Filter HTTPS"** restores the Sora and Project folders, but this is not an ideal solution as HTTPS filtering is needed. > Additionally, adding **chatgpt.com** to the **User Filter** does not resolve the issue. > > > Username: `@AbhishekBasnet` ### Screenshots

issue.title: chatgpt.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. Observe that the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. > > #### Expected Behavior > The Sora and Project folders should remain visible and accessible even when **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled. > > #### Actual Behavior > As soon as **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled, the folders disappear. > > #### Additional Information > - **OS Version**: Win 11 pro Build 26100.3476 > - **AdGuard Version**: 7.20.2 (4988) > > #### Workaround > Disabling **"Filter HTTPS"** restores the Sora and Project folders, but this is not an ideal solution as HTTPS filtering is needed. > Additionally, adding **chatgpt.com** to the **User Filter** does not resolve the issue. > > > Username: `@AbhishekBasnet` ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.huffpost.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: www.huffpost.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body: @Alex-302 I still had the same issue on Firefox 136.0, on MacOS It seems this filter causes the problem. I tried `UNBLOCK` this filter and the problem has resolved.

comment.body:
Hi Alex,
I had some time to play with rules for azure today. Finally, I have found and unblocked the following rule: "@@||applicationinsights.azure.com^".
So, I guess, the root cause was found and fixed. No more questions from my side - we can close this ticket.
Many thanks for your help. Have a good day!

Также будет исправлено здесь https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/577. Рекомендуется установить AdGuard Extra.

---

Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. issue.title: www.huffpost.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

issue.title: chatgpt.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chatgpt.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchatgpt.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Bug Report: Sora and Project Folders Disappear When Enabling "Filter HTTPS" in AdGuard > > #### Description > When enabling the **"Filter HTTPS"** option in **Network settings** of AdGuard, the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. This issue occurs consistently when the setting is turned on. > > #### Steps to Reproduce > 1. Open **AdGuard** and go to **Settings**. > 2. Navigate to the **Network** section. > 3. Enable the **"Filter HTTPS"** option. > 4. Observe that the **Sora and Project folders** disappear. > > #### Expected Behavior > The Sora and Project folders should remain visible and accessible even when **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled. > > #### Actual Behavior > As soon as **"Filter HTTPS"** is enabled, the folders disappear. > > #### Additional Information > - **OS Version**: Win 11 pro Build 26100.3476 > - **AdGuard Version**: 7.20.2 (4988) > > #### Workaround > Disabling **"Filter HTTPS"** restores the Sora and Project folders, but this is not an ideal solution as HTTPS filtering is needed. > Additionally, adding **chatgpt.com** to the **User Filter** does not resolve the issue. > > > Username: `@AbhishekBasnet` ### Screenshots

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

comment.body:
Not reproduced with AdGuard filters from the config above on my end.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

labels.name: A: In progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script)
 [http://s.ee](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fs.ee)
### Comment
> Hello,
> 
> We recently discovered that our URL shortening service domain, s.ee, has been blocked by AdGuard DNS. We take the safety and security of our service very seriously and have implemented comprehensive measures to ensure it is not used for phishing or malicious purposes. Specifically:
> 
> We actively monitor all URLs generated by our users daily. If we identify any phishing or illegal content, the associated user accounts are immediately banned, and the malicious URLs removed.
> 
> We synchronize daily with well-known phishing databases to proactively block malicious URLs and domains, minimizing any possibility of abuse.
> 
> We handle and investigate user and third-party reports of misuse promptly. Verified malicious links and responsible accounts are blocked swiftly upon confirmation.
> 
> Given our proactive and diligent approach, we kindly request a review of our domain (s.ee) and guidance on the necessary steps to have it removed from AdGuard DNS's blocked list.
> 
> 
> Thank you for your prompt attention and assistance.
Username: `@showfom`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/m5n9r4etghsw40cgg84c4k4kw840gc88zwz1lvrlv4.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value

AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings

pull_request.title: Fix #200734 mkvcinemas.kim
pull_request.body:
Fix https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/200734

For some reasons, `#%#//scriptlet('prevent-addEventListener', 'DOMContentLoaded', 'shown_at')` causes breakage for me, but `abort-current-inline-script` does not. Can anyone reproduce?

I don't use `domain=` for regex since wildcard is not supported in MV3 I think?

`domain` with `*` works, but processed by filters compiler.
Like here
https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/chromium-mv3/filters/18_optimized.txt
`@@||geolocation.onetrust.com/cookieconsentpub/v1/geo/location$domain=tripadvisor.*`

pull_request.title: Fix #200734 mkvcinemas.kim
pull_request.body:
Fix https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/200734

For some reasons, `#%#//scriptlet('prevent-addEventListener', 'DOMContentLoaded', 'shown_at')` causes breakage for me, but `abort-current-inline-script` does not. Can anyone reproduce?

I don't use `domain=` for regex since wildcard is not supported in MV3 I think?
